snippet: Senator John McCain, back from a surprise trip to Syria, offered his bleakest assessment yet of the hostilities there, saying that President Bashar al-Assad, with growing outside backing, was beginning to tighten his grip on power.
abstract: Senator John McCain, back from a surprise trip to Syria, offered his bleakest assessment yet of the hostilities there, saying that President Bashar al-Assad, with growing outside backing, was beginning to tighten his grip on power.

headline.main: McCain Says Assad Has Gained the 'Upper Hand' in Syria

keywords.name: subject
